question: Consider an experiment in which a fair coin is flipped 3 times. Define the random variable A to be the number of flips that come up heads. Which choice corresponds to the distribution over A?
explanation:
Correct

A has a value of 3 for only one outcome (HHH), so p(A = 3) = 1/8.
A has a value of 2 for three outcomes (HHT, HTH, THH), so p(A = 2) = 3/8.
A has a value of 1 for three outcomes (HTT, THT, TTH), so p(A = 1) = 3/8.
A has avalue of 0 for only one outcome (TTT), so p(A = 0) = 1/8.
